formalMetadata.description: A text that requires a reading ability above the upper secondary education level, with a summary at the bottom that does not require a reading ability higher than lower secondary education level.
formalMetadata.title: Difficult text with readable summary
formalMetadata.dc:creator: Christophe.Strobbe@esat.kuleuven.be

recommendation.label: XHTML™ 1.0 The Extensible HyperText Markup Language (Second Edition)

purpose.p: This test case is intended to pass because the summary at the bottom does not require a reading ability higher than lower secondary education level. Only the reading level is tested here, not the other aspects of the document (descriptive section titles, expanded forms for abbreviations, etcetera).

expertGuidance.p: Check whether the summary at the bottom does not require a reading ability higher than lower secondary education level.

questionText.p: Does the summary help you understand the rest of the content?
Helpt de samenvatting u om de rest van de inhoud te begrijpen?

functionalOutcome.p: The summary at the end of the document helps readers with a reading level that is not higher than lower secondary education level.

techComment.p: This test case maps to technique G86: Providing a text summary that requires reading ability less advanced than the upper secondary education level.

functionalOutcome.p: The summary at the end of the document helps readers with a reading level that is not higher than lower secondary education level. (The summary in the test file could be made easier to read.)
